programme.title: Texas Rising
programme.desc: On the eve of battle, the Texan army is restless and dangerously close to mutiny. Deaf Smith returns with crucial information on the Mexican troops.

programme.title: Monster Croc Wrangler
programme.desc: Matt Wright and the team catch a lethal king cobra, trap a 12ft crocodile and help the rescue team dart and relocate a herd of wild elephants.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The duo find a valuable collection of vintage toys in Iowa, while Mike is inspired to take a gamble on an unusual item.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank head to Minnesota and challenge Danielle to sell a fibreglass cowboy boot they bought more than a year previously.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth is excited when a clergyman sells him a rare baseball signed by Babe Ruth, complete with authentication papers - and knows it could be worth several thousand dollars.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A man brings in a 160-year-old Tiffany watch, which has no identifying markings other than the name on its face. The pressing question is how the company verify that it is genuine.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick restores a classic guitar for Brettly's birthday, and a rare hunting scooter arrives in the shop.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick turns to Danny Koker from Counting Cars for help with a mysterious scooter, and a dentist brings the guys a 1920s x-ray machine that may be too dangerous to restore.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The team restores an unusual wheelchair made out of parts from a Second World war aircraft, and Kelly has an anniversary surprise for Rick.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: An antique horse-drawn sleigh arrives at the shop needing a complete transformation for the holidays. Big Mike comes by with a 1930s Dixie Cup dispenser that is missing a key part.

programme.title: The Misadventures of Romesh Ranganathan
programme.desc: The comedian visits countries that are rarely visited by tourists to get a sense of the local culture and find out if they deserve their reputation. His first destination is Haiti, a country mostly famous for a dictatorship and a series of natural disasters. Accompanied by journalist Jeremy Dupin, he visits the iron market, attends vodou ceremonies, and explores a cathedral destroyed by an earthquake.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Host Dara O Briain and regulars Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons are joined by James Acaster, Ed Byrne, Sara Pascoe and Josh Widdicombe on the topical comedy quiz. The panellists give their take on the week's major news stories and participate in a series of stand-up spots and improvised games. First shown in 2014.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Actor, writer and TV presenter Richard Ayoade takes over the reins for an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with Pointless co-host Richard Osman and comedian Kiri Pritchard-McLean joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Rhod Gilbert's Work Experience
programme.desc: The comedian steps out of the spotlight to learn another trade, trying his hand at the distinctly glamourless profession of farming - and his introduction to the job sees him mucking out the cows.

programme.title: Rhod Gilbert's Work Experience
programme.desc: The comedian must try to keep his temper in check as he becomes a lord's butler for the day and is challenged to look after the gentry at an exclusive dinner party.

programme.title: The Misadventures of Romesh Ranganathan
programme.desc: The comedian visits countries that are rarely visited by tourists to get a sense of the local culture and find out if they deserve their reputation. His first destination is Haiti, a country mostly famous for a dictatorship and a series of natural disasters. Accompanied by journalist Jeremy Dupin, he visits the iron market, attends vodou ceremonies, and explores a cathedral destroyed by an earthquake.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A marooned ironclad structure off the coast of England that hides a dramatic story of war and resilience, and a facility in the heart of America that helped tear apart a nation.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The story of America's â€˜Liberty Ships', which were produced in incredible numbers and became known as the Model T Fords of the ocean.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey describes how Winston Churchill drew on the lessons of his ancestor John to lead the UK through the Second World War. At two key moments, the prime minister's strategic sense helped avert disaster, and in both decisions, the influence of the Duke of Marlborough is apparent. Starkey argues that it was Winston's ability to control events by giving them a narrative meaning that enabled him to shape world history long after his fall from power.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on another expedition through some of Britain's most historic landscapes. The moors and valleys of West Yorkshire were the home of, and inspiration for, the Brontes, the literary family who produced such classics as Wuthering Heights and Jane Eyre. Over four days, Tony heads out from the Victorian wool capital of Bradford and treks in a giant loop around what is now known as Bronte Country. From the birth of Charlotte, Emily, Anne and their brother Branwell in the suburb of Thornton, he traces their childhoods to the much-romanticised Bronte hub of Haworth, finding that the harsh reality of life in the 1820s was far removed from the fantasy world dreamed up by the children at their father's parsonage home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Last Post
programme.desc: Mary goes into labour while her husband has left the city to rendezvous with the SAS, who are returning to Aden after a secret mission to capture a dangerous fugitive. When things go badly wrong, Harry must choose between his men and his family. An American reporter ingratiates herself with the troops, to Joe's annoyance, and Honor joins an exclusive club.

programme.title: Tess of the D'Urbervilles
programme.desc: The death of Tess's father results in her family being forced out of their house, and she again finds herself at the mercy of Alec, who offers the Durbeyfields a home and support. Angel returns from Brazil and tracks down his wife, but his visit drives Tess to despair, and she lashes out at her benefactor Alec before spending one last night with Angel. Starring Gemma Arterton.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Gerry and the team agree to help a man who believes his wife is still alive, even though she apparently died 18 months earlier in a car accident. They decide the best way to convince him is to have her exhumed - only to be faced with more questions than answers when it turns out the body is not hers after all. Meanwhile, Brian needs to find a handyman when Esther bans him from his latest DIY project. Hugh Dennis and Samuel West guest star, with Amanda Redman.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The squad reopens the investigation into an actress's disappearance when clips of her being assaulted in a 1990 movie are posted on the internet. Director Don Maddox features in the footage, but when questioned, he appears to have problems distinguishing fact from fiction. A potential witness is then found dead, and Brian and Jack are seconded to the unit handling the case, only to find Emily Driscoll (Dennis Waterman's daughter Hannah) is heading the operation. Imogen Stubbs and Sandra Dickinson also guest star.

programme.title: Sophy Ridge on Sunday
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest news headlines, plus analysis of current affairs issues with leading politicians, a review of stories in the day's national newspapers and weather reports.

programme.title: Bring Back The Boybands!
programme.desc: All the best videos from some of the biggest boybands ever, right here on Magic.

programme.title: Late Night Magic
programme.desc: We're taking you all the way through the night with soem of the best tracks of all time.

programme.title: The Kisstory Takeover
programme.desc: Kisstory is taking over with non-stop old skool and anthems.

programme.title: Up All Night! Kiss Beats
programme.desc: Let the world sleep! But here at Kiss we are still up, still delivering the finest beats for your nocturnal jam.

programme.title: Chart Hits & New Vids
programme.desc: We've got all the hits that are storming the charts right now, along with some brand new releases from your favourite and new artists.

programme.title: Hit After Hit
programme.desc: Nothing but the biggest hits by your favourite stars back to back.

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: An eyewitness in Spain offers the team a key clue in their search for Hitler's escape route from Europe. In Argentina, the hunt for his U-boat continues.

programme.title: Treasure Quest: Snake Island
programme.desc: The treasure hunters make a new discovery, and a run-in with a jaguar leads to another revelation. However, the new path has tragic consequences for Captain Keith.

programme.title: Supertruckers
programme.desc: Kev causes chaos in Norfolk transporting a huge 29-ton sea crane from Great Yarmouth to the Suffolk port of Felixstowe, while James tries to keep the other angry drivers at bay.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: After winning the Favourite Wish-Maker Award, the team decides to build a special bike for the children of the Make-a-Wish Foundation.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Mike's '39 Hudson Coupe-Convertible is the only survivor of three that were built. He wants Fantomworks to undo previous repairs and restore it to original condition.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado Drew Pritchard and Turbo Pickers' Paul Cowland head to Somerset to hunt down a 1970s VW Type 3 Fastback. They also revamp a Rover P6 built at the height of the British Leyland crisis.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: Developments in the manufacture of wax figures, awnings, cream crackers and pewter tankards.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Pipe Cleaners/Blue Stilton Cheese/Smart Electric Meters/Telescopes
programme.desc: Developments in the manufacture of pipe cleaners, blue Stilton cheese, smart electric meters and telescopes.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Following the lives of people, each weighing over 600lbs. Through their year-long journeys, they attempt to lose thousands of pounds collectively, to survive.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: A search for a missing man uncovers a cold blooded murder. Plus, a couple uncover a dark secret when they find a shallow grave under their new house.

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: Police investigate when a neurologist reports the death of a patient, leading to his and the 'dead' patient's eventual arrest.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of 24-year-old Megan Sharpton, who was raped and murdered before her body was set alight in July 2012. The torment led to her mother committing suicide.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The Safe Streets Task Force monitor the violent acts of a notorious gang of hoodlums who have acquired a reputation for antisocial behaviour.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: The Arizona Humane Society rescues two dogs from a man accused of practising veterinary medicine without a licence.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: Dr. Peter performs risky surgery on a guinea pig. Plus, a German Shepherd is rushed into the clinic with suspected paralysis from a tick and a snake needs specialist help. S1/5/10

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Consultant Sarah becomes engaged and looks for a dress of her own, while Sola searches for a gown that will reflect her culture.
